National Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Finland 
    Pyongyang, November 22 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the Juche idea was held in Helsinki on Nov. 12 under the sponsorship of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
 The chief of the Finnish Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Jong Il in his speech referred to the fact that the Korean people have won victory after victory, working world-astonishing historic miracles in the revolution and construction, holding aloft the banner of the Juche idea.
 The director of the "Komin Forum" Information Agency said that the U.S. moves against the DPRK are a crude violation of international law and order, adding that it was a just measure for defending the independence of the country and socialism that the DPRK has built up powerful armed forces.
 The chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea clearly proved the originality, justness and great vitality of the Juche idea and highly praised the immortal Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung as the guiding idea of progressive mankind in the 21st century.
 A message to leader Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.content:
Authorities' Policy for Opening Rice Market under Fire 
    Pyongyang, November 22 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for O Chu Ok, director for cultural affairs of the Women Farmers' Association in Songju County, North Kyongsang Province, who committed a suicide in protest against the authorities' opening of the rice market and a "national meeting of farmers for checking the rice market opening and Bush's visit to south Korea" reportedly were held in Pusan on Nov. 18.
 Speakers said at the service and meeting that she did not commit a suicide, but she was murdered by the neo-liberal "globalization" and the system of WTO. 
 Noting that the U.S. is chiefly to blame for having reduced the Korean farmers to the poor and made them suffer, they assailed the governmental authorities for busying themselves with pleasing the U.S., lending no ear to the farmers' demands.    
 It is the duty of the surviving farmers to drive the U.S. out of south Korea because it is forcing the neo-liberal "globalization" upon it.
 The participants chanted slogans "Let farmers take the lead in the struggle to smash the neo-liberal 'globalization'" and "We oppose the U.S. pressurizing south Korea to open its rice market."

Struggle against Scheme to Revive Pro-U.S. Conservative Regime Called for 
    Pyongyang, November 22 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils was reported to have called on all the people to unite and foil the plot of the U.S. and its lackeys anti-reunification forces to revive the pro-U.S. conservative "regime."
 Kim Ro Jin, chairman of the organization, in an appeal on Nov. 17 disclosed the U.S. and anti-reunification forces' scheme to block the reunification on the Korean Peninsula at any cost and bring pro-U.S. conservative "government" back to south Korea.    
 The general orientation of the struggle of youth and students in the latter half of this year is to put a break on the U.S. and its follower forces' moves to bring back the pro-U.S. conservative regime and deal a blow at them, the appeal said, calling for waging a widespread struggle to eliminate the pro-U.S. conservative forces beginning with an all-people rally for the abolition of the "National Security Law" on Dec. 3.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
    Pyongyang, November 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Nov. 19 sent a congratulatory message to Blaise Compaore upon his reelection as president of Burkina Faso.
 The message expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and wished the president bigger success in his responsible work for peace and prosperity of the country.
